body_html: I had the same issue with cuda.is_available(). In the end the issue is not pytorch related, it was coming of improper installation of cuda-toolkit. I have ubuntu 18.04 and Cuda 9.2. While runing ./deviceQuery in cuda samples I found that I have an nvidea driver 390; however, cuda 9.2 requires driver 396.xx. After re-installing the driver everything worked fine and torch.cuda.is_available() returns True

body: I had the same issue with `cuda.is_available()`. In the end the issue is not pytorch related, it was coming of improper installation of cuda-toolkit. I have `ubuntu 18.04` and `Cuda 9.2`. While runing `./deviceQuery` in cuda samples I found that I have an nvidea driver 390; however, cuda 9.2 requires driver 396.xx. After re-installing the driver everything worked fine and `torch.cuda.is_available()` returns `True`
